edu.ou.asgbook.filters.QuickSelect

edu.ou.asgbook.filters.QuickSelect Class Reference

From Numerical Recipes, a fast way to find the kth smallest item in a list Useful to implement rank filters. More...

static int kth_element (int[] arr, int k)
static int kth_element (int[] arr, int n, int k)
 Finds the kth smallest item in the list.

Detailed Description

From Numerical Recipes, a fast way to find the kth smallest item in a list Useful to implement rank filters.

Author:
v.lakshmanan

Member Function Documentation

static int edu.ou.asgbook.filters.QuickSelect.kth_element ( int[]  arr,
int  n,
int  k 
) [static]

Finds the kth smallest item in the list.

Parameters:
arr list
n number of elements in list, in case the last elements of list are unfilled
k finds kth smallest
Returns:
00032                                                            {
00033         if (k > n){
00034             throw new IllegalArgumentException("k should be less than n!");
00035         }
00036         int i, ir, j, low, mid;
00037         int a;
00038 
00039         low = 0;
00040         ir = n - 1;
00041         for (;;) {
00042             if (ir <= low + 1) {
00043                 if (ir == low + 1 && arr[ir] < arr[low]) {
00044                     SWAP(arr, low, ir);
00045                 }
00046                 return arr[k];
00047             } else {
00048                 mid = (low + ir) >> 1;
00049                 SWAP(arr, mid, low + 1);
00050                 if (arr[low] > arr[ir]) {
00051                     SWAP(arr, low, ir);
00052                 }
00053                 if (arr[low + 1] > arr[ir]) {
00054                     SWAP(arr, low + 1, ir);
00055                 }
00056                 if (arr[low] > arr[low + 1]) {
00057                     SWAP(arr, low, low + 1);
00058                 }
00059                 i = low + 1;
00060                 j = ir;
00061                 a = arr[low + 1];
00062                 for (;;) {
00063                     do
00064                         i++;
00065                     while (arr[i] < a);
00066                     do
00067                         j--;
00068                     while (arr[j] > a);
00069                     if (j < i)
00070                         break;
00071                     SWAP(arr, i, j);
00072                 }
00073                 arr[low + 1] = arr[j];
00074                 arr[j] = a;
00075                 if (j >= k)
00076                     ir = j - 1;
00077                 if (j <= k)
00078                     low = i;
00079             }
00080         }
00081     }
